column9: *Defaults to current date if none given

column1:
Optional

If you leave this field blank, the gGRC system will generate Codes automatically upon creation of the new object.  If you have a standardized acronym or other specific reason for entering Codes manually, we recommend doing so.  Otherwise, we recommend you leave this blank.

Enter the Codes for already existing objects if you want to use Import as a means to edit and update those objects.
column4: PBC Requests require either a Control or an Objective, but it may be added later, after importing
column5:
Optional Text Field
Use this text field to keep notes about this Request
column7: If not specified, value will default to Audit Lead
column10: Draft / Requested / Responded / Amended Request / Updated Response / Accepted

column1: Requests can have custom attributes. Custom attributes are defined by admins. You will know when custom attributes are defined by the fact that they will show up in the Custom Attributes panel on any Request.
Custom attributes can be set through import by adding columns to the import template where the column header is the name of the attribute.

Columns for attributes that don't exist will be ignored. You will be prompted when uploading/importing the template about the extra attributes. This prompt is purely informational and does not require any action on your part.
When you have custom attributes defined for Requests and columns in the import template are left out
column2: the values of those attributes on the Requests you upload will be nullified/unset/removed.
